page.title: 01HOLT.WORCS.
page.content: The area, which is divided across the North East corner by the River Severn, consists primarily of arable farmland. 300 acres is being quarried for sand and gravel. There are two main roads through Holt Parish, one of which crosses the River Severn at Holt Fleet, and the two form a cross-roads at Holt Heath. It is important to note that the 1828 bridge designed by Thomas Telford is the only point of access across the river between Stourport and Worcester. The Wychavon Way, a recreational footpath, starts at Holt Fleet Bridge. Holt Castle and Church are historically the most interesting buildings.
